result.execSummary:
The defendant Fercardo M Graffree was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 214 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of zero.
Pay DNA surcharges; 
Court waives all other court costs due to defendant's inability to pay.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
If defendant is incarcerated DNA surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Referral to the mental health unit.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fercardo M Graffree

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant
Defendant's letter request to remove mandatory DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING (27 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 25, 2015 received and filed.
Costs were added in error. See corrected JOC for correct amount.

Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.   Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 214 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 years probation.
  Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- referral to the mental health unit
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.  No possession of drug paraphenalia
- Random urine screens.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of zero
Pay DNA surcharges; Court waives all other court costs due to defendant's inability to pay
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
If defendant is incarcerated DNA surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Jury trial remains on the court's calendar until the next court date.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-25-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel and State request adjournment for status.
Defendant has pending cases in Branch 23.
Court will accept Case# 13CM005378 and 14CM000041 for global resolution, providing that Branch 23 is willing to transfer the cases and that they are resolved on the next court date; if not those cases to remain on Branch 23 calendar.

Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

State's Witness List received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for soft plea and sentencing and jury trial in Branch 19.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand entered this date.

Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:   Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department Detective Joseph Mazurczek.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.     All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is not present for today's proceedings, defendant is refusing to appear in Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Court orders that the defendant be present on the next scheduled court appearance date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $2500.00 CASH.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Timothy Cotter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, witness not present for today's proceedings.  Defense is requesting a bail modification.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Defendant will not come to court.
Case in court for contested doctor's report hearing. Sworn for the State: Dr. Karyn Gust-Brey.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Defendant refuses to come to court.  Case adjourned for contested doctor report hearing in Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order To Produce Transport
Report dated 05/22/2015 received and scheduled for return on doctors report 06/09/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed.  Defendant to be admitted to MMHI today.
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed.  Defendant awaiting transfer and is 13 out of 23 on admission list.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in Court for competency hearing.  Defendant refuse to leave cell again. Video conference cannot proceed with the Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, hearing on competency proceeded at this time.  Sworn for the State, Dr. Mary Kay Luzi, Psychologist.  The Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended. DHS is authorized to administer medication(s) or treatment to the defendant and she observe appropriate medical standards in doing so.

The defendant is committed on 04/16/2015 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment.

Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. Pre-trial incarceration credit recieved amd filed. Case adjourned for Return on Doctor's Report in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Parties selected a next Court date that would allow for video conferenceing and the Doctor to be available. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report, however due to lack of video conference availability, a new Court date was selected.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  If video conference is available on the next date the hearing will proceed, if not, the date will be used to identify a date that works for all parties and video conferencing.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in custody. Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for hearing, however video conference is necessary but unavailable to today's proceedings.  At Court's request, hearing rescheduled for 04/09/2015 and will comence on that day assuming video conferenc is available. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Fercardo M Graffree not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Defendant is contesting the findings.  Case scheduled for competency hearing in Branch 22 with Dr. Luzi.  Video conference will NOT be available for the next hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in custody. Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  
Defendant Fercardo M Graffree in custody.  
George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defense pleads Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Count.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
